title: Riot-Doublelift is consistently toxic and trash talks every LCS team live, why is he not punished?
body:
He always brags everytime his team wins and he insults other teams in a passive-aggressive manner. He has done this for years, yet Riot overlooks it. Are pros not held accountable for their actions? Are the people who aren't pros held to a higher standard? I would love a Rioter's input.

Doublelift- paraphrasing but basically he said "Well, of course we won it was CLG, they're bad-- gg ez."

replies.body: When you're talking in person with someone after the game, you're totally allowed to say the same things. Just don't type it in chat. Sounds like the same standard to me.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=fV5FqGYw,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-04T04:59:25.300+0000)
>
> When you're talking in person with someone after the game, you're totally allowed to say the same things. Just don't type it in chat. Sounds like the same standard to me.

He's doing exactly what people are permabanned for, except he's doing it for thousands of people to see instead of 4 or 9 people.

He's saying that they won the game, it was easy, normal trash talking. That is very different from someone telling someone else to go F*** themselves and/or kill themselves. He's not using profanity, and imo he sort of seems like he's poking fun at the other team.

if he's typing in chat "ggez" then yeah that's punishable, but people have been correct that riot can't punish him for what he says live on stream unless their rules for pro player conduct say anything about it.

Unfortunately that alone is not worth punishment, been reporting people for it since that was said by a Rioter and I've not gotten one single pop up saying 'Thank you for reporting someone toxic' or the equivalent, except one time I and a premade reported one guy .-.
i'm gonna believe that was a coincidence then, since premades shouldn't and are stated dont affect the likeliness of a punishment

> [{quoted}](name=Leblancster,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=fV5FqGYw,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-06-04T05:30:41.893+0000)
>
> He's doing exactly what people are permabanned for, except he's doing it for thousands of people to see instead of 4 or 9 people.

No. He isnt doing it in game, distracting people from game creating negativity during game. Its punishable if u do those things in game.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=fV5FqGYw,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-04T04:59:25.300+0000)
>
> When you're talking in person with someone after the game, you're totally allowed to say the same things. Just don't type it in chat. Sounds like the same standard to me.

Yup... this is why OddOne can say what he does.. ON STREAM... Not in chat.

Actually, if you pay attention to the scene at all, players do get fined for the things that they say/do.  IWD was not able to compete for a year and lost all his accounts due to in game toxicity.  WXW was banned for a year for ELO boosting.  Hai was fined 500 euros for flipping off another player.  So yes, they are held accountable.

You also have to understand, he's not doing this in game, these are interviews and his own thoughts.  It would be ludicrous if Riot banned you for saying "fuck you" to one of your classmates/coworkers.

Except he's also not saying "fuck you" to anyone. 

Trash talk is common in all sports. You just can't do it 'on the field' so-to-speak. 

Hell, they even trash talk each other during dual-interviews (2 different teams' players) at times.

What is your problem?
I don't get it, you're always ranting about Riot and stuff ... but you still keep playing the game nearly on a daily base.
If you don't like Riot or how they handle their game, just shut the fuck up and leave.

Based on the majority of the comments here, then there should be thousands of perma-bans lifted. I'm just saying if Riot is going to permaban someone for calling someone else a "poopoo head" or saying the word "report" then Doublelift needs to be fined and/or punished to sit out a few games for as much as he trash talks. 

Riot needs to stop discriminating against non-pro players and letting the pros get away with murder.

Leblancster, serious question, aren't you able to use your brain?

There is a huge difference between someone abuse the chat system and a pro bantering while a interview.
1.  What ever, if they overstate while a interview, they get fined (like Hai for flipping his finger)
2. If they call someone a retard or what ever in the chat while a pro game goes on, they will get fined too
3. There are some fucking **INGAME** rules, if a pro (like IWD) don't care, they not only get a account ban, but also a suspension from competitive playing and maybe a ban of sight ... 
No shit, Pro's get much harsher punishments then a fucking casual. Or do you lose your source of income if you get a account ban?
4. You still play the game, just leave if you don't like Riot or how they handle their game.

Edit: rofl, 6 games yesterday, you're one of the biggest  hypocrites I've ever saw  ;D

I think you need to take an english class because it's "I've ever seen" and secondly, how does me playing the game make me a hypocrite? I enjoy dumpstering bad players and kids like you all day. All I said was that the pros need to follow the rules. Meteos is obviously extremely toxic, yet Riot puts him all over the front page. Krepo was never investigated and they swept it under the rug and prevent anyone from talking about it. Doublelift trash talks every single person in-game and out of game, and no one wants to play with him because he is such a dick. 

Pros do not deserve special treatment, they should be punished on the first sight of toxicity since they are the public image of this game. I bet all you fanboys who are defending them are the same people advocating that more and more people should be banned, or you justify every ban in the player behavior and moderation forums. You can't be on both sides of the fence.

> how does me playing the game make me a hypocrite?

Because you don't stop ranting about how Riot treat their customer?! Sense?
If you don't like how Riot handle their game, apply rules and what ever, don't play it or at least stop bad mouthing Riot over and over again. 
I mean, you accept their rules every patch again and again, if you don't agree with them, don't click the "accept" button.
It's like having a girlfriend, because u like her, but you constantly talk shit behind her back, because she has fat fingers.

Accept it, Riot won't change their attitude about toxic player.

> Pros do not deserve special treatment, they should be punished on the first sight of toxicity since they are the public image of this game. 

?
That would be a special treatment.
Btw. if Meteos is toxic ingame, he will get a ban like every other player. (if he get reported for that)

Is he doing it in game? No? Then it doesn't matter. I can say out loud, to myself and my friends, whatever terrible things I can come up with about everyone on my team or the enemy team, and it doesn't matter even in the slightest. As long as I haven't hit enter, typed anything out, and then hit enter again, I can say whatever I want.
Dlift is the ultimate trash talker. Rito wouldn't ever censor that. It gets them views on their vids.

I love Doublelift's comments sometimes. Aphromoo does the same thing. Just how sports operate.

Anyway, last night TSM 2-0'd CLG, and in his interview Double said:

"Immortals wouldn't have gotten swept last split if they played seriously...and something about beating FreeLG."

These are funny comments. Not meant to insult or be toxic necessarily but just lighthearted BM. The comments put him on the spot (like whenever they play Immortals/CLG is gonna be hilarious) but nothing super serious.
Trash talking/BM and toxicity aren't the same tho.

I'm guessing you've never played a sport? Trash talking is literally the best part of anything competitive. If you break up a pass, you best talk shit to the wide receiver. Otherwise, it doesn't count.

Nope, you can get in trouble for calling people names out of game. I got a warning for calling someone an idiot on the boards. j/s 

On the other hand, it was an interview, and many athletes trash talk before and after the game.
"Because muh LC$" - Riot
